newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Lai Sun Dev shares down after placement.
newsitem.headline: Lai Sun Dev shares down after placement.

text.p: Shares of property group Lai Sun Development Co Ltd fell on Thursday on dilution fears after the company announced a share placement plan, brokers said.
"Investors were seen taking dilution fears as an excuse to take profit after the recent rally," said a sales director at a regional brokerage.
Lai Sun shares were down HK$0.35 or 2.77 percent to HK$12.30 in mid-morning on volume of 182.92 million shares. The shares had risen HK$0.55 or 4.55 percent during the week.
Lai Sun Development said it would issue 165 million new shares to parent Lai Sun Garment (International) Ltd at HK$12.00 per share after Lai Sun Garment places the same number of shares.
The company said it would use the proceeds to replenish its land banks in Hong Kong.

Lai Sun Development also said it would issue a further 79.05 million new shares at HK$12.65 per share to chairman Lim Por Yen to buy the remaining 50 percent of Causeway Bay Plaza 1 which it does not already own.
